title: How to Enable Google Play Protect

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store.
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store. Select the Google Play Store icon ( ) to open the app from the home screen or the app drawer. If your device supports Google Assistant, you can say the wake words, "Okay Google" and then say "Open Play Store".

steps.title: Open the Play Store menu.
steps.content: Open the Play Store menu. On the top-right side of the screen, select the avatar icon to open the play store menu.

steps.title: Open Play Protect.
steps.content: Open Play Protect. Scroll down the menu to find Play Protect , select it to open the page to configure Play Protect.

steps.title: Open Play Protect settings.
steps.content: Open Play Protect settings. On the top-right corner, tap the setting icon, representing a cog, to open Play Protect settings.

steps.title: Enable the security.
steps.content: Enable the security. Slide the slider to right in order the enable Play Protect. Enabling this grants Google the rights to scan your device on a regular basis and remove malicious software and files. You may also turn on Improve harmful app detection by sliding the slider to right; this will help the developers at Google to improve their detection algorithms.
